title: Yogi Adityanath to lead consecration at Ayodhya Ram Temple on June 5
content: This would be the second consecration event at the temple in over a year, with the first one taking place last January

title: BSF jawan 'abducted' by Bangladeshi nationals, released later
content: The jawan was attempting to prevent an infiltration bid from the Bangladesh side near Kathalia village, when he was captured by miscreants from Chapai Nawabganj district of Bangladesh, according to BSF sources.

title: NIA raids multiple locations in J&K in terror conspiracy case
content: The raids were carried out in Pulwama, Kulgam, Shopian, Baramulla and Kupwara districts, says an officials

title: India lags behind rest of the world in AI adoption; only 15% of SMEs use AI: BCIC
content: AI adoption in manufacturing stands at 35–40%, with significant uptake in China, Germany, and the U.S. Yet India lags behind. Only 15% MSMEs adopt AI in manufacturing’

title: JSP celebrates NDA’s one year in office as YSRCP observes ‘Vennupotu Dinam’ in Vizag
content: YSRCP alleges that the NDA government has failed to meet the expectation of the people while JSP recalls that the opposition party could win 11 of the 175 Assembly seats in 2024 elections

title: Polavaram-Banakacherla project DPR being readied for submission to Centre: Naidu
content: Annadata Sukhibhava scheme is likely to be launched this month for the benefit of farmers, says the Chief Minister

title: 35% of road accident victims in Cyberabad are pedestrians: data
content: Across the Cyberabad commissionerate, 70 black spots have been identified, and in 32 of them, pedestrians account for nearly half of the total fatalities.

title: World Environment Day | Ceiling fans are used almost everyday; their power consumption can be cut by half by switching to BLDC tech
content: A BLDC fan — which runs on Direct Current — consumes less energy. Similarly, a conventional tube light of 40 Watt consumes 0.4 kWh. And, a LED Batten of 20Watt consumes 0.2 kWh, according to the Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE).

title: S.P. Balasubrahmanyam statue to come up at Ravindra Bharathi
content: The decision to install the statue at Ravindra Bharathi was made in accordance with Balasubrahmanyam’s wishes, and the Music Culture Association has welcomed the move

title: Circling back to Rajiv Gandhi’s assassination, a traumatic moment in Madras’ history
content: Just as another May recedes, Chennai continues to grapple with heat and the odd summer rain. There is also the matter of dealing with a queasy memory from a distant night, one that altered India’s political landscape.

title: Betrayal day observed: Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Mr. Jagan said the massive turnout for this State-wide programme reflects the pain, frustration and resistance of the betrayed public

title: Panchayat Raj officials survey hilltop hamlet for laying road in Anakapalli district
content: The officials visited the hamlet after The Hindu highlighted the travails of tribal people in carrying the sick in dolis in the absence of roads

title: ‘Small Matters’: Shashi Tharoor on Kerfuffle Over Trump’s Claims On Brokering India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Mr Tharoor is leading a multi-party delegation to the Americas in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attacks and India’s response via ‘Operation Sindoor’

title: Move to set up MSME park in every Assembly constituency gets Cabinet nod
content: Proposal to allot 50 acres for development of a Quantum Valley in Amaravati approved; government to work with IIT Madras, TCS, and IBM to set up State Quantum Mission

title: In Istanbul, Russia and Ukraine talk peace but are still far apart on truce
content: While agreements were reached on prisoner exchange, there has been no word on talks to potentially end the conflict; a ‘full and unconditional ceasefire’ remains central to Ukraine’s agenda; Russia says the ‘root cause’ of the conflict, NATO’s expansion, should be addressed for durable peace

title: Man from Bihar planted over 10000 saplings at own cost
content: Considering major challenges and issues in ecology, he started a campaign right from 2007 as a case study to protect environment in public domain

title: Parents of a 12-year-old child from Bengal who worked in Gujarat allege torture, file police complaint
content: The child with injuries all over his body has been admitted to Kalna State General Hospital and is undergoing treatment

title: Teenager flogged in West Bengal on allegations of mobile theft, now missing
content: The victim was reportedly working in a garment factory in South 24 Parganas district; the factory owner is absconding

title: Sena (UBT) expels a party leader, two days after his meeting with CM
content: Sudhakar Badgujar had a meeting with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on June 2 in Nashik where he expressed his displeasure over the functioning of Shiv Sena (UBT) and claimed that about a dozen other leaders have been unhappy with the party.

title: Rajasthan CM calls for harnessing youth power for nation-building
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma launched the campaign here on the eve of the World Environment Day and unveiled its official poster

title: Indigenously developed weapons proved their might in Operation Sindoor: PM Modi
content: PM tells Ministers priority should be accorded to ‘Make in India’ with regard to weaponry as much as possible

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Madhya Pradesh on journalists’ plea alleging assault by police
content: The Bench of Justices Sanjay Karol and Satish Chandra Sharma refused to grant interim protection from arrest to the journalists

title: Chhattisgarh government nod for policy to promote tourism in tribal-dominated areas
content: Bastar and Sarguja are the two tribal-dominated regions of the State and are known for their natural beauty

title: Bengaluru stampede: 'Free ticket' rumour sparked stadium chaos that killed 11
content: Chaos erupted at Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium's Gate No. 7 as massive crowds gathered on rumors of free tickets to celebrate RCB's anticipated IPL victory. A stampede ensued, exacerbated by sudden rain, leading to numerous injuries. Eyewitnesses reported poor crowd management and delayed decisions regarding a victory parade contributed to the disaster.

title: Trump bans entry of nationals from 12 countries. Who is on the list?
content: President Trump has implemented a travel ban on nationals from 12 countries, citing national security concerns related to screening and vetting deficiencies. The White House highlights high visa overstay rates and lack of cooperation in accepting removable nationals as key factors.

title: 'I did not die, I was killed': Cry posters at funeral of honeymooner murdered in Meghalaya
content: Raja Raghuvanshi was discovered murdered in Meghalaya, and his wife, Sonam, is still missing, prompting allegations of a botched investigation. The family is demanding a CBI probe and Army assistance, claiming local police are not taking the case seriously.

title: 'Unsuitable': Trump bars foreign students from coming to study US at Harvard
content: President Trump has suspended international visas for new Harvard students, citing national security concerns and alleged inadequate reporting of foreign student information. The White House criticized Harvard's foreign connections, handling of antisemitism, and emphasis on DEI. This action follows a judge's ruling that previously prevented the administration from modifying Harvard's international student visa program.

title: Op Sindoor: Did India mean to send a message to China too? Shashi Tharoor responds
content: Leading an all-party delegation in the US, MP Shashi Tharoor lauded Operation Sindoor, India's military action against terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan. Tharoor highlighted the operation's success in bypassing Chinese radar systems and sending a clear message to Pakistan.

title: War twist: Ukraine’s drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,600; BSE Sensex up 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex was up 100 points.

title: 'A deadly welcome to IPL champions': Former World Cup winner
content: Syed Kirmani, the legendary Indian wicketkeeper, expressed grief over the death of 11 RCB fans during victory celebrations, terming it a "deadly welcome." He questioned the evolved nature of fandom compared to his playing days, suggesting organizers could have waited to ensure proper arrangements for felicitating the IPL champions.

title: Spiritual advice: Elon Musk’s father Errol says; If the world followed Shiva..
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, is currently visiting India and expressed admiration for the nation's rise and spiritual heritage. He intends to visit the Ram Temple in Ayodhya, finding Hinduism fascinating and globally beneficial if the world followed Lord Shiva's wisdom.

title: 'Absolutely gutted': Kohli reacts to tragic stampede during RCB celebrations
content: Virat Kohli expressed his devastation following the stampede outside Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's victory celebrations, resulting in 11 fatalities and 33 injuries. The joyous occasion turned tragic as authorities struggled to manage the massive crowd on Wednesday evening, June 4. Kohli shared RCB's statement, conveying his sorrow.

title: 'There is no apology for that': Yograj slams Shreyas Iyer after IPL final loss
content: Yograj Singh has strongly criticised Shreyas Iyer's dismissal in the IPL 2025 final, calling it a "criminal offence" that significantly contributed to Punjab Kings' defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Iyer's early exit for just 1 run put pressure on PBKS, ultimately leading to a narrow six-run loss as RCB secured their first IPL title.

title: Kidney Stones vs Gallbladder Stones: What is the difference
content: There are different types of kidney stones, including calcium stones, which are the most common. Next is the struvite stones caused by infections, uric acid stones linked to diet and metabolic issues, and cystine stones that might be genetic. In terms of pain, kidney stones often cause severe agony, when they move through the urinary tract, blocking urine flow and causing symptoms like sharp back or side pain, blood in urine, and frequent urination

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'Beyond tragic': Sachin Tendulkar breaks silence on Bengaluru stampede
content: A tragic stampede in Bengaluru, following Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, resulted in 11 deaths and 33 injuries, prompting grief from Sachin Tendulkar and RCB. The incident occurred outside Chinnaswamy Stadium, leading to the cancellation of a victory parade. Karnataka's Chief Minister has ordered an inquiry, acknowledging the unexpected crowd size and expressing sorrow over the erased joy of victory.

title: NBA finals: When, where to watch Game 1 Indiana Pacers vs. Oklahoma City Thunder
content: The 2025 NBA Finals are set with an unexpected matchup between the Oklahoma City Thunder and the Indiana Pacers. Game 1 tips off on June 5 in Oklahoma City, following dominant playoff runs by both teams. Viewers can catch the action on ABC and various streaming platforms as these young, talented teams battle for the championship.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Anger erupts against netas & cops for turning joy into grief
content: Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium witnessed tragedy due to a confluence of factors, including overenthusiastic fans, poor planning, and inadequate communication. The RCB victory parade announcement caught authorities off guard, leading to a failure in crowd control. Political figures prioritized photo opportunities over safety, exacerbating the chaos and resulting in preventable loss of life, highlighting systemic failures in managing the event.

title: US DOE threatens Columbia's accreditation over antisemitism concerns
content: The Trump administration has intensified its conflict with Columbia University, alleging inadequate protection of Jewish students following the October 7th Hamas attack. The Education Department informed the Middle States Commission on Higher Education of Columbia's alleged Title VI Civil Rights Act violation, potentially jeopardizing its accreditation and access to federal funding.

title: Maharashtra FYCJ registration window closing at 2 PM: Direct link to apply
content: The Maharashtra FYJC Class 11 admission portal will close today, June 5, 2025, at 2 PM. With over 20 lakh seats in 9,200+ junior colleges statewide, students must register at mahafyjcadmissions.in by paying a Rs. 100 fee. The provisional merit list releases today, followed by counselling and document verification in the coming days.

title: With tech, census data to be out much faster than in past
content: India's Census, delayed by Covid, is likely to commence on April 1, 2026, culminating on March 1, 2027. This census will record caste for the first time since 1931 and will be conducted digitally. The data is crucial for delimitation and implementing women's quota in legislatures, with results expected faster due to digitization.

title: World saw India’s strength during Operation Sindoor: PM to ministers & top babus
content: Prime Minister Modi lauded Operation Sindoor's success, highlighting the swift demolition of Pakistan's terror infrastructure in just 25 minutes. He emphasized the evolving nature of warfare, noting the absence of traditional military movements. Modi urged ministers to focus on ambitious goals, global standards, and saturation in projects.

title: New York Giants rookie Cam Skattebo fails to recognise NFL legends in viral quiz
content: New York Giants rookie Cameron Skattebo faced criticism. A video showed him struggling to identify NFL legends. This sparked debate among fans on Reddit. Some were angry, others empathetic. The discussion broadened to generational gaps in NFL knowledge. Fans discussed the transience of fame. Skattebo's experience highlights the importance of understanding NFL history.

title: 'Harshest critics': Wayne Gretzky's daughter Paulina on overcoming criticism
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of hockey legend Wayne Gretzky, is making waves as a style icon. Recently, she was spotted in a striking white mini-dress, showcasing her ability to blend elegance with confidence. Beyond fashion, Paulina has also shared her journey of self-acceptance, emphasizing the importance of self-love and positive energy in navigating public perception and personal growth.

title: Govt confident of Parliament consensus on Yashwant Varma's removal
content: Justice Yashwant Varma faces potential removal through a Parliament motion due to corruption allegations, with most parties signaling unity on the issue. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju is confident of securing support across party lines for the motion, expected to be introduced during the monsoon session.

title: Collegium system reforms can't be at cost of judicial independence: CJI
content: Amidst calls for reform, CJI Gavai defended the collegium system, emphasizing that judicial independence must be paramount in appointments to the Supreme Court and High Courts. He highlighted the system's evolution as a response to executive overreach, citing instances of judicial supersession.

title: Painting believed to be only one Gandhi sat for going under hammer at Bonhams
content: A rare oil portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, believed to be the only one he ever posed for, is set to be auctioned at Bonhams in July. Painted by British artist Clare Leighton in 1931 during Gandhi's visit to London, the artwork remained within Leighton's family until now.

title: Criminals overpower BSF jawan, drag him into Bangladesh
content: A BSF jawan, Shri Ganesh, was forcibly dragged into Bangladesh by Bangladeshi nationals near the Chandni Chowk border outpost. The incident occurred while he was questioning them, leading to his detention in Satrashiya village. Following a flag meeting between BSF and BGB, he was returned after four hours, with BSF denying initial assault claims and vowing to prevent future occurrences.

title: 'This also happened': Meghan Markle shares labour dance video to mark daughter's 4th birthday
content: Meghan Markle celebrated Lilibet's fourth birthday by sharing a video on Instagram of herself dancing while in labor. The Duchess of Sussex posted the amusing clip alongside a heartfelt birthday message. Prince Harry also made a cameo in the video, joining Meghan in a synchronized squat as they awaited their daughter's arrival.

title: ‘Thug Life’ early review: Kamal Haasan's film is a 'cult classic'
content: Mani Ratnam and Kamal Haasan reunite after 36 years with 'Thug Life,' featuring music by A.R. Rahman and a stellar cast. Early reviews are positive, calling it a potential cult classic, but controversy arises in Karnataka over Kamal Haasan's past remarks about the Kannada language. Despite the challenges, the film is generating significant buzz and high ticket sales.

title: Who is Rocky Jaiswal? Meet Hina Khan's longtime partner & now husband after 13 yrs of dating
content: Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai fame Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal celebrated their union on June 4th after a 13-year courtship. Rocky, a Supervising Producer who met Hina on her debut show, has been a constant support. Together, they launched Hiro’s Faar Better Films and co-own Katch Klothing.

title: India wants WTO's dispute settlement mechanism back
content: India has prioritized restoring the WTO's dispute settlement mechanism and advocated for special treatment for developing nations. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal reiterated India's opposition to incorporating plurilateral initiatives like investment facilitation into the WTO framework. He urged focus on pending agricultural issues and the removal of non-tariff barriers to strengthen the WTO.

title: Learning outcome India's key school challenge: Unesco
content: A recent UNESCO report reveals India's struggle with learning outcomes and school leadership despite high primary school enrollment. Globally, the report highlights a significant under-representation of women in educational leadership roles, from principals to ministers, even though they form a majority of the teaching workforce.

title: India stands committed to ambitious climate action: Bhupender Yadav
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav addressed critical environmental issues, emphasizing India's commitment to reducing single-use plastic through bans and extended producer responsibility. India advocates for a consensus-based international agreement on plastic pollution, balancing environmental concerns with sustainable development. The government is also reassessing its climate action pledges, considering national circumstances.

title: LGBTQIA+ couples have right to find a family: Madras high court
content: Madras High Court affirmed that individuals can form families regardless of the Supreme Court's stance on same-sex marriage, recognizing 'chosen families' in LGBTQIA+ jurisprudence. The court criticized the use of 'queer' to describe non-heterosexual individuals and condemned the police's insensitive handling of a case involving a lesbian woman separated from her partner, ordering protection for the couple.

title: Work withdrawn from Punjab judge after HC admin recommends his compulsory retirement
content: Following the Punjab and Haryana High Court's recommendation for his compulsory retirement, judicial responsibilities have been withdrawn from District and Sessions Judge Tejwinder Singh. The recommendation has been sent to the Punjab government for notification. Singh gained prominence for convicting six individuals in the Kathua rape and murder case, a trial moved to his court by the Supreme Court.

title: Centre to fast-track green nods for all Indus river basin projects
content: Following the government's decision to keep the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance after the Pahalgam attack, the Centre will expedite environmental clearances for pending and proposed projects in the Indus River Basin in J&K. This initiative aims to maximize water utilization from the river system, prioritizing strategic projects like hydro-electric power and irrigation infrastructure.

title: Bengaluru stampede: 'Cops tried to enforce queues but people pushed from all sides'
content: A celebratory parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru turned tragic as a massive crowd surge led to chaos and fatalities. Among the victims were a young girl, a tech worker, and a student, all caught in the crush. Families are now grappling with the sudden loss of their loved ones, highlighting the devastating consequences of the uncontrolled event.

title: Ex-judges in post-retirement jobs or poll fray hit public trust: CJI
content: CJI B R Gavai expressed concerns about judges resigning to contest elections or accepting government posts post-retirement, highlighting potential ethical issues and erosion of public trust. He emphasized that such actions could compromise judicial independence and impartiality, creating perceptions of conflicts of interest.

title: 'Graft in judiciary has negative impact'
content: Amidst the uproar over the discovery of a large sum of cash at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence, Chief Justice of India (CJI) B R Gavai addressed the critical issue of maintaining judicial legitimacy and public confidence. He acknowledged that instances of corruption and misconduct within the judiciary negatively impact public trust.

title: Biden-era press secretary quits Democratic Party, says memoir's publisher
content: Karine Jean-Pierre, ex White House press secretary, quits the Democratic Party, accordint to publisher of her new book. She plans to release a memoir. The book will reveal details of Joe Biden's decision to not seek re-election. It will also eportedly expose the Democratic Party's 'betrayal'. The memoir is titled 'Independent: A Look Inside a Broken White House, Outside the Party Lines'.

title: FIR alone no ground to impound passport, says J&K HC
content: The Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court overturned a CBI court's decision, stating that merely having an FIR or pending investigation isn't enough to deny, impound, or withhold passport renewal. This ruling came after a retired IAS officer's passport was seized during a raid related to an investigation into illegal arms licenses.

title: Celebration turns tragedy: 11 dead in Bengaluru stampede; political slugfest erupts
content: Tragedy struck Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations as a stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in eight fatalities and over 40 injuries. Overwhelmed by massive crowds, police struggled to maintain control despite a heavy presence. The Karnataka government's prior cancellation of a victory parade due to security concerns proved prescient.

title: 'True definition of a son': NBA legend Allen Iverson shares heartfelt post
content: Allen Iverson recently shared a heartfelt Instagram post praising his son, Isaiah Rahsaan Iverson, highlighting his admirable qualities and expressing immense pride. This follows a previous dedication to his ex-wife, Tawanna Turner, showcasing their past together. Despite facing financial struggles post-retirement, Iverson's life is seemingly improving with a new role at Reebok.

title: Son Dead In Bengaluru Stampede, Inconsolable Father Makes A Request
content: A man who lost his son in the stampede in Bengaluru yesterday appeared inconsolable, pleading with the authorities to return his body without an autopsy. "At least give his body. Don't do a postmortem. Don't cut his body into pieces," he urged.

title: Celebrations, Then Tragedy: A Timeline Of Bengaluru Stampede That Killed 11
content: Bengaluru stampede: Marred by last-minute changes and an underestimation of cricket fans who would show up, the RCB celebration turned ghastly, killing at least 11 people.

title: "US Has Understood That India...": Shashi Tharoor On Ties With Pakistan
content: The US has clearly understood India's position that there can be no dialogue with Pakistan with a "gun pointed at our head", Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said.

title: "We Don't Want Them": Donald Trump Puts US Travel Ban On These 12 Countries
content: US President Donald Trump signed a new travel ban Wednesday targeting 12 countries including Afghanistan, Iran and Yemen, reviving one of the most controversial measures from his first term.

title: Indian Students Are Deleting Social Media Posts, Accounts For US Visas: Report
content: Students are not just deleting posts, fearing that their political jokes, views and activism might be misinterpreted during visa interviews, but also entire accounts.

title: US Court Stays Deportation Of Family Of Colorado Attack Suspect
content: A US judge on Wednesday ordered a temporary stay on any efforts to deport the family of a man suspected of carrying out a Molotov cocktail attack on Jewish protesters at the weekend.

title: Chinese Woman, Boyfriend Arrested For Smuggling Biological Pathogen Into US
content: According to an FBI criminal complaint, Zunyong Liu, 34, a researcher currently in China, brought the fungus into the United States while visiting his girlfriend, Yunqing Jian, 33, in July 2024.

title: Trump Orders Probe Into 'Conspiracy' To Hide Biden's 'Mental State'
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday ordered an investigation into what Republicans claim was a "conspiracy" to cover up Joe Biden's declining cognitive health during his time in the White House.

title: "Kill The Bill": Elon Musk's Latest Attack On Trump's Spending Bill
content: Elon Musk has unleashed yet another assault on US President Donald Trump's flagship spending legislation, urging Americans to lobby Congress to "KILL the BILL" - mere days after departing his position within the Trump administration.

title: Army Officer Goes Missing While On Morning Walk In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: An Army officer posted in Sagar town of Madhya Pradesh went missing after leaving his residence for a morning walk two days ago, a police officer said Wednesday.

title: Trump Bans Visas For Foreign Students At Harvard
content: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a proclamation to restrict foreign student visas at Harvard University, the White House said on Wednesday, amid an escalating row with the academic institution.

title: US Vetoes UN Security Council Call For Gaza Ceasefire
content: The United States on Wednesday vetoed a draft U.N. Security Council resolution that demanded an "immediate, unconditional and permanent ceasefire" between Israel and Hamas militants in Gaza and unhindered aid access across the war-torn enclave.

title: "We Apologise For This Incident": DK Shivakumar On Bengaluru Stampede
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Wednesday offered an apology after 11 people were killed in a stampede near the Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru following RCB victory celebrations.

title: "Operation Sindoor Was Brilliantly Chosen Name": Shashi Tharoor In US
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, who is leading the all-party delegation to the US, said Operation Sindoor was a "brilliantly chosen name" and explained its significance.

title: White House Defends Trump Mega-Bill After Elon Musk Attack
content: The White House on Wednesday blasted a prediction that Donald Trump's policy mega-bill could send the deficit soaring, as Elon Musk doubled down on his criticism of the US president's plans.

title: "It Is In Your DNA": JP Nadda Slams Rahul Gandhi's Surrender Remark
content: BJP National President and Union Health Minister JP Nadda on Wednesday slammed Congress MP and Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of insulting the Indian Army by terming the success of Operation Sindoor a "surrender".

title: Raj Thackeray Says "Only Marathi, English Should Be Taught From 1st Grade"
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) Raj Thackeray on Wednesday appealed to state School Education Minister Dadaji Bhuse to issue a written order "as soon as possible" stating that only two languages, Marathi and English.

title: Satellite Pics Of 2 Russian Airbases Reveal Extent Of Damage By Ukrainian Drones
content: Hi-resolution satellite images of two of the five Russian air bases targeted by Ukraine in its audacious drone attack have emerged, giving a glimpse of the destruction caused by the explosive-laden drones.

title: 3 Of Family Die Of Suffocation While Cleaning Septic Tank In UP: Cops
content: Three members of a family died due to suffocation while cleaning a septic tank outside their house here on Wednesday, police said.

title: Video: Biker Performs Zig-Zag Stunt In Front Of Delhi Bus, Bike Scrapped
content: A man on a Royal Enfield Bullet found himself in trouble after riding recklessly and performing stunts in front of a Delhi transport bus. Police teams were formed, and the biker was traced through an Instagram video.

title: Bangladesh drops the title of ‘Father of the Nation’ for Sheikh Mujibur Rahman
content: The new notification brought on June 3 does not refer to Sheikh Mujib as the ‘Father of the Nation’ while referring to the war of 1971 and the role of freedom fighters

title: Key accused in ₹4,215-crore Falcon scam nabbed in Hyderabad; luxury cars seized
content: The arrest took place in Hyderabad on Tuesday, in a case that spans multiple states and involves thousands of duped investors

title: Happy that my hard work paid off, says AP topper in JEE (Advanced) Vadlamudi Lokesh
content: Vadlamudi Lokesh, secured an all-India 10th rank in the JEE (Advanced) 2025 and is also the State topper, eyes IIT-Bombay

title: SCTIMST launches multi-centric study on air pollution and heart health
content: Other than SCTIMST, the study is being carried out at All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi and Dayanand Medical College, Ludhiana

title: Tragedy at stadium: Karnataka CM says they did not anticipate crowd surge; announces compensation of ₹10 lakh
content: He also announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh to the family of the deceased and free treatment to 33 injured persons undergoing treatment in hospitals

title: IIT-Madras launches School of Innovation and Entrepreneurship to boost startup ecosystem
content: The new school aims to unify all campus innovation initiatives, offer academic programs including an MS in Entrepreneurship starting July 2025

title: 28-year-old pharmacist arrested for practising medicine without qualification in Tirupattur
content: N. Ajith Kumar operated a clinic-cum-pharmacy in Venkatasamudram village, treating 35-50 patients daily without any professional medical qualifications

title: New pedestrian subway to enhance safety at Polur railway crossing near Tiruvannamalai
content: The subway, featuring tiled footpaths, steel hand railings, and stormwater drainage, is expected to be completed within three months; it is expected to improve daily commutes for over 6,000 passengers, including pilgrims and local residents

title: Kadapa child rape-murder accused found dead in reservoir; suicide suspected
content: Rahmatullah’s family reportedly refused to claim his body. As a result, municipal workers conducted the final rites under the supervision of authorities

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport gasps for breath as terminal capacity utilisation crosses 100%
content: While international terminal utilised over 100% terminal capacity in the just-concluded fiscal, the capacity utilisation of domestic terminal was about 200% last year

title: What went wrong?: Confused messaging over victory parade, open-air event at Vidhana Soudha led to stampede in Bengaluru
content: Suggestions to hold the victory celebrations on Sunday were shot down by the political leadership, sources said.

title: Bengaluru stampede: How what was to be a victory celebration ended in a tragedy
content: Desperate to get a glimpse of the famed trophy and the players of RCB, the crowds resorted to climbing trees, compound walls and even roofs of buildings. It was at the stadium that things came to a head

title: Top hoteliers unite, form ASHA, to strengthen hospitality sector in A.P.
content: The association aims to elevate the State as a premier travel destination, promote excellence in hospitality, and foster collaborations with top-tier hotels

title: Seriously discussed walking away, Ashoka University co-founder says amid row
content: Ashoka university is ‘too much of a headache’, Sanjeev Bikhchandani says while asking if the alumni are willing to take over its administration

title: 3 injured in attack on Dalit wedding procession in U.P.’s Amroha; caste abuse alleged
content: Police said they had to resort to mild force to disperse the crowd and restore order; in view of the heightened tensions, a police force has been deployed to maintain law and order

title: Nothing less than treason, says BJP on Rahul Gandhi’s ‘surrender’ remark
content: Rahul terming the unmatched valour and courage of the Indian armed forces a ‘surrender’ is not only unfortunate but also a grave insult to them and 140 crore Indians, says Nadda

title: Assam floods claim two more lives, Mizoram clocks 675 landslides
content: Lieutenant Colonel, his wife and daughter are among six missing in Sikkim’s Mangan district, which was marked a disaster zone by the government

title: Bengal Congress leader joins Trinamool, says only it can fight BJP
content: Shankar Malakar boosts Trinamool Congress’ electoral prospects in 2026 Assembly elections by joining party

title: No reason to delay for 23 months, says Congress after government announces Census schedule
content: The Modi government is capable only of generating headlines, not meeting deadlines, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Bengal plans 800-km ‘green wall’ along Jharkhand border
content: Will act as a shield in intercepting pollutants entering the State, says W.B Pollution Control Board Chairperson Kalyan Rudra

title: Webinar on liver disease to be held on June 8
content: Metabolic Dysfunction — Associated Steatotic Liver Disease is an increasingly common yet often undiagnosed liver condition driven by metabolic disorders such as obesity, Type 2 diabetes, and insulin resistance

title: Centre asks States to ensure supply of medical oxygen, isolation beds, ventilators
content: Seven more deaths due to COVID-19 reported in the country; active cases rise to 4,302; public advised to practise hand hygiene, cough etiquette, and avoid crowded places when unwell

title: Government to bring new national policy on senior citizens
content: The Social Justice Ministry says discussions focused on how the draft policy should “reflect the demographic realities” of India as it heads into the future

title: Dishing out tasty treats made of milk
content: Final-year BTech (Dairy Technology) students of College of Dairy Science and Technology at Kaimanam run food stalls in the city selling value-added products from milk

title: Delimitation delay ploy to reduce Tamil Nadu’s voice in Parliament: CM Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister alleges BJP’s postponement of Census to 2027 is aimed at altering State’s representation and urges “fair delimitation”

title: Waqf Umeed portal tantamount to contempt of court, claims Muslim Board
content: The AIMPLB contends that at a time when petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 are under consideration of the Supreme Court such a move is tantamount to contempt of court

title: Railways suspends 2.5 crore user IDs suspected of fraudulent ticket booking
content: IRCTC deployes anti-bot systems to curb bookings by unscrupulous agents and reduce bot traffic during the first five minutes of the Tatkal booking window

title: Bar Council nod for government law college in Chamarajanagar
content: College granted permission to admit 60 students for the three-year LL.B course for academic years 2025–26 and 2026–27

title: Atwood foils walk attempt to lift Horns at WCWS
content: Reese Atwood hit a go-ahead, two-run single for Texas when Texas Tech ace NiJaree Canady was trying to walk her, and the Longhorns beat the Red Raiders 2-1 in Game 1 of the Women's College World Series finals Wednesday night.

title: Day: Big Ten deserves 4 automatic spots in CFP
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day would like to see future College Football Playoff models include at least four automatic qualifying spots for the expanded Big Ten.

title: Manfred 'paid attention' to Trump support of Rose
content: Rob Manfred took President Donald Trump's support of Pete Rose into account when the MLB commissioner decided that permanent bans by the sport ended with death.

title: Ronaldo fires Portugal past Germany to NL final
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner as Portugal fought back to beat Germany 2-1 on Wednesday and reach the Nations League final.

title: Red Sox win on shortest walk-off HR on record
content: Ceddanne Rafaela curled a 308-foot home run around the Pesky Pole in the bottom of the ninth inning on Wednesday, and the Red Sox rallied after trailing four different times to beat the Angels 11-9.

title: Michigan offers 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr.
content: Michigan has extended an offer to class of 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr., opening its recruitment of the son of Pro Football Hall of Famer and Wolverines 1997 Heisman Trophy winner Charles Woodson.

title: Source: No investigation into Storm assistant
content: The WNBA followed up on an allegation that a Storm assistant coach cursed at an Aces player after the teams' game Sunday, but no investigation was launched, a source said.

title: Djokovic drops 1st set, outlasts Zverev at French
content: Novak Djokovic, the No. 6 seed, proved too much for No. 3 Alexander Zverev, winning 4-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 to set up a French Open semifinal showdown vs. No. 1 Jannik Sinner.

title: 🏀 Five Knicks questions after firing Thibodeau
content: NBA insiders examine why the Knicks parted ways with Thibodeau and which coaching candidates could be right for New York.

title: The Paul George Trade is about to deliver an NBA title
content: The Thunder and Pacers can trace their superstars and their cores back to trades involving the nine-time All-Star wing.

title: It takes a village? Inside the MLB ballpark model of the future
content: The Battery Atlanta is an enticing blueprint for teams. But creating an entire neighborhood is a hard act to follow.

title: 2025 FC 100: Yamal, Mbappe among best men's soccer players
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

title: NBA coaching carousel: Suns, Spurs, Nuggets find successors -- but what's next for the Knicks?

title: We pitched trade offers for three NFL stars: Landing spots for Ramsey, Cousins, Hendrickson

title: U.S. visa uncertainties put college rosters in a bind

title: USMNT's Steffen (knee) set to miss Gold Cup

content: Manchester City have agreed a deal worth €55 million ($62m) with AC Milan for midfielder Tijjani Reijnders, a source has told ESPN.
